nl.tudelft.ti1100a.audio
Class LoopMixer.Loop

java.lang.Object
  nl.tudelft.ti1100a.audio.AbstractEffectable
      nl.tudelft.ti1100a.audio.LoopMixer.Loop
All Implemented Interfaces:
AudioSignal, Effectable, Recordable
Enclosing class:
LoopMixer
public class LoopMixer.Loop
extends AbstractEffectable
implements AudioSignal, Effectable, Recordable

A loop in a LoopMixer. To create a new Loop, use loopMixer.new Loop(...).

Author:
Mara Bos (m-ou.se@m-ou.se)

Constructor Detail

LoopMixer.Loop

public LoopMixer.Loop(java.lang.String filename,
                      float beats)
Creates a new Loop.

Parameters:
filename - The filename of the audio fragment to use.
beats - The number of beats in that audio fragment.

LoopMixer.Loop

public LoopMixer.Loop(java.lang.String filename,
                      float measuresPerLoop,
                      float startPosition)
Creates a new Loop.

Parameters:
filename - The filename of the audio fragment to use.
measuresPerLoop - The number of measures in that audio fragment.
startPosition - The position in the audio fragment, in seconds from the beginning, where the first measure begins.

getVolume

public float getVolume()
Returns the current volume. (The average of the left and right volume.)

See Also:
getVolumeLeft(), getVolumeRight()

getVolumeLeft

public float getVolumeLeft()
Returns the current volume of the left channel, as a factor of the original (ie. 1 for 100%).

getVolumeRight

public float getVolumeRight()
Returns the current volume of the right channel, as a factor of the original (ie. 1 for 100%).

isPlaying

public boolean isPlaying()
Returns whether the loop is currently playing or not.

remove

public void remove()
Remove the Loop from the LoopMixer. Do not use the loop after it's removed.

removeListener

public void removeListener(AudioListener l)
Specified by:
removeListener in interface Recordable

restart

public void restart()
(Re)starts the loop. The loop will start on the right place to let its first beat match the closest measure beat in the Rhythm of the LoopMixer.

restart

public void restart(int measure)
(Re)starts the loop in the specified measure. The loop will (re)start on the right place in the specified measure to match the Rhythm of the LoopMixer. Negative numbers can be used too. For example, -1 specifies the last measure.

Parameters:
measure - The measure to start in.

sampleRate

public float sampleRate()
Specified by:
sampleRate in interface Recordable

setExactOffset

public void setExactOffset(int newOffset)
Changes the offset.

Parameters:
newOffset - The new offset, in samples.

setNumberOfMeasures

public void setNumberOfMeasures(float measures)
Changes the speed.

Parameters:
measures - The number of measures one loop will take.

setOffset

public void setOffset(float newOffset)
Changes the offset.

Parameters:
newOffset - The new offset, in seconds.

setVolume

public void setVolume(float volume)
Changes the volume of both the left and the right channel.

Parameters:
volume - The new volume, as a factor of the original (ie. 1 for 100%).

setVolumeLeft

public void setVolumeLeft(float volume)
Changes the volume of the left channel.

Parameters:
volume - The new volume, as a factor of the original (ie. 1 for 100%).

setVolumeRight

public void setVolumeRight(float volume)
Changes the volume of the right channel.

Parameters:
volume - The new volume, as a factor of the original (ie. 1 for 100%).

start

public void start()
Starts the loop. The loop will start on the right place to let its first beat match the closest measure beat in the Rhythm of the LoopMixer. If the loop is already playing, nothing happens.

start

public void start(int measure)
Starts the loop in the specified measure. The loop will start on the right place in the specified measure to match the Rhythm of the LoopMixer. Negative numbers can be used too. For example, -1 specifies the last measure. If the loop is already playing, nothing happens.

Parameters:
measure - The measure to start in.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the loop.

type

public int type()
Specified by:
type in interface Recordable
